title: Trnjb5ANow
content: Breathing exercises can help manage stress and mental illness symptoms. Mobile apps offer new ways to learn and practice these exercises. A study evaluated different visual representations of breathing exercises to determine effectiveness. Two visuals were found to be more effective than others, and some users did not prefer auditory guidance. Usability issues were identified, and design guidelines were suggested for future improvements. The study evaluated visual representations of breathing exercises and identified usability issues, suggesting design guidelines for future app-supported training development.
